title: L3Harris’ sensor satellite for medium Earth orbit constellation passes review
summary: The company is competing in the U.S. Space Force’s Medium Earth Orbit (MEO) Missile Warning and Tracking program

title: Iridium to take over GPS backup provider for $115 million
summary: Iridium Communications announced plans March 4 to buy out Satelles, which provides an alternative to GPS via the satellite operator’s L-band network, marking the first acquisition in the 36-year-old company’s history.

title: BlackSky wins defense contract to supply satellite data to train AI models
summary: Satellite “burst images” captured in quick succession will be used to help improve accuracy of AI models to track moving targets

title: SpaceX launches Transporter-10 rideshare from Vandenberg
summary: On Monday, March 4, 2024, SpaceX launched the Transporter-10 rideshare mission from Space Launch Complex 4E at Vandenberg Space Force Base (VSFB). Liftoff occurred at 2:05 PM PST (22:05 UTC).

title: Blue Origin is getting serious about developing a human spacecraft
summary: Company seeks: "Experience with human spaceflight or high-performance aircraft systems?"

title: Space Force eyes smaller, cheaper GPS satellites to augment constellation
summary: The military is interested in a “rapidly prototyped Global Positioning System navigation satellite with an objective to significantly reduce size, weight, power and cost”

title: Astra warns of liquidation if proposal to go private falls through
summary: The board of spacecraft propulsion and launch vehicle company Astra has warned that if it is unable to complete a deal offered by the company’s founders to go private, its only option is to liquidate the company.

title: Crew-8 Up and Away
summary: Weather finally cooperated for the NASA/SpaceX Crew-8 to lift off late Sunday evening on their way to the International Space Station. Docking is expected about 3:00 am on Tuesday. Three […]

title: NASA Gets Significant Cut in Final FY2024 Appropriations
summary: House and Senate appropriators released their final agreement on six FY2024 appropriations bills today including the one that funds NASA, Commerce-Justice-Science. The agency will get $24.875 billion, half a billion […]

title: Crew-8 launches to space station
summary: A Crew Dragon spacecraft is on its way to the International Space Station with four Americans and Russians on board after a launch March 3.
